body:
New version.  Was wondering if "at" should instead be ":" but mechanically searching for last occurrence of " at " is probably about as reliable as searching for second-to-last ":" or "::".

```
./escape_because.go:37: leaking param: q
./escape_because.go:37: 	from s (assigned) at ./escape_because.go:38
./escape_because.go:37: 	from pair literal (struct literal element) at ./escape_because.go:39
./escape_because.go:37: 	from t (assigned) at ./escape_because.go:39
./escape_because.go:37: 	from u (assigned) at ./escape_because.go:40
./escape_because.go:37: 	from &u (address-of) at ./escape_because.go:41
./escape_because.go:37: 	from &u (interface-converted) at ./escape_because.go:41
./escape_because.go:37: 	from sink (assigned to top level variable) at ./escape_because.go:17
```
